market_sentiment.summary: Gold is consolidating after a volatile week, supported by USD weakness and ongoing geopolitical/tariff uncertainty, but capped by easing Middle East tensions and mixed Fed expectations.

news_highlights.headline: Gold rose to 3,352.41 USD/t.oz on July 1, 2025, up 1.49% from the previous day
Gold price builds on recovery and gains positive traction for second successive day
USD drops to lowest level since February 2022 on fiscal concerns
Trump tariff deadline uncertainty benefits gold's safe-haven status
Markets price 74% probability of Fed rate cut in September
Gold price takes a beating on ceasefire news, falls $50 an ounce
Israel and Iran agree to complete ceasefire per Trump announcement
Global gold ETFs see record inflows of $9.4bn in February
Central banks double gold purchases to over 1,000 tonnes annually
RSI at 35.57 suggests bearish trend with strong ADX momentum at 41.86
Gold rises on weaker dollar, tariff uncertainty before deadline
Gold rebounds from over one-month low on weaker dollar
Gold set for second weekly loss; US inflation data in focus

forecast_scenarios.short: Gold likely to remain range-bound between 3,250 and 3,370 in the short term, with upside potential if resistance at 3,370 is broken.
forecast_scenarios.medium: Fed policy decisions and US economic data will drive direction; sustained USD weakness and renewed geopolitical risks could push gold above 3,400.
forecast_scenarios.long: Institutional buying and central bank demand provide long-term support, but further upside depends on macroeconomic and geopolitical developments.

key_events.event: Trump tariff deadline; potential new tariffs if no trade deal
Expected Fed rate decision (74% probability of rate cut)

risk_factors: Geopolitical developments (Middle East ceasefire, tariff deadlines)

final_decision.reasoning: Both AI sources indicate mixed technicals and sentiment: USD weakness and institutional demand support gold, but easing geopolitical risks and uncertain Fed timing cap upside. Consensus is to hold with cautious optimism for a breakout if resistance is cleared.
